txt.en: <rgb=#00FF00>Laugh</rgb> with Raphûz
As you speak, she seems suspicious of you and Raphûz
Wait for Ashâmi to take her leave
Listen to Raphûz's story
Speak with the woman who emerged from the shadows
'I heard. It is your beloved pet if what stories I heard are true.'
'Yes.'
'You mewl like a boar's piglet. It is no wonder you fear a large boar.'
'Your mother? I do not understand.'
'Me?'
Wait for the conversation to end
'I am half-Shagâni. My father -'
'Why are you here?'
Raphûz is waiting for you to speak with him.
'No, why are so many from the north here?'
'I do not understand. What did she mean, my friend? Ah, the hour is late. I should sleep. Thank you for lending your ear again.'
'Come, my friend, sit with me.'
Raphûz made his way to the fireside and invited you to sit.
'I do not understand. What did she mean, my friend? Ah, the hour is late. I should sleep. Thank you for lending your ear again.'
Raphûz wants to thank you for your aid and again invites you to sit with him for a discussion and a smoke.
Raphûz invited you to partake in his smoking device. Perhaps you should smoke your own pipe.
Wait for Raphûz to finish speaking
Wait for Raphûz to finish speaking
Speak with Raphûz
Wait for the woman to finish speaking
<rgb=#00FF00>Sit</rgb> with Raphûz
'My grandfather, having no sons or grandsons to send to the army, was conscripted. He was too old and did not survive long.'
'The Heirs took his livelihood and drove my entire family into financial ruin.'
Raphûz finished his statement with a hearty laugh. You should laugh with him.
Wait for the woman to finish speaking
Share a <rgb=#00FF00>smoke</rgb> with Raphûz
'My parents were never bitter or saddened and always made life fun.'
'They were magnificent people. Their dream of returning to Shagâna instilled in me a desire to see this land and follow through on their dreams.'
'I have so much fear. Taking this post was a step I never thought I could.'
A woman emerged from the shadows. She speaks with confidence and asks why so many from the north travel into Shagâna.
As you speak, she seems suspicious of you and Raphûz. You explain how you accompanied the expedition south to aid in stopping the rise of great evil. The woman listens quietly and then speaks.
Speak with Raphûz to get his reaction
'You surprised us. Please, join us. I am Raphûz, this is my friend [placeholder], and you are?'
You explain how you accompanied the expedition south to aid in stopping the rise of great evil
'Ashâmi. I would take the deer. It is important to me.'
The woman listens quietly and then speaks
You hear the sound of ruffling fabric from the shadows...
The woman introduced herself as Ashâmi. She asked for the deer. Raphûz appears stunned see if you can make him respond.
Listen to Rapûz's story
Wait for Ashâmi to take her leave
Wait for the conversation to end
Wait for the conversation to end
Wait for the conversation to end
Ashâmi left the fireside with the deer in tow. Raphûz watches her recede into the night.
DNT - Replace this with leaving the instance.
Raphûz calls as you approach, 'Come, my friend. Sit with me.'
'It is you.'
'Not a pet. My mother.'
'How do you know about my fear of... boars?'
'You would not understand. I do not expect you to. You are not Shagâni.'
'Enough. May I take the deer?'
'Yet, here I am. Thanks to you and your efforts, I am on a path to reclaim my father's name.'
'Mayhaps I shall overcome my fear of boars with your aid.'
'Thank you for your assistance. I am indebted, really.'
'They always told the same story of their first meeting. My mother worked in my grandfather's stall selling rugs. My father delivered the materials used to weave the rugs.'
'They said they knew from the moment their eyes met their love was destined.'
'As a boy, I found the story very dramatic. They would always smile and kiss after telling it. They loved each other dearly.'
'My grandfather did not think my father a suitable match for my mother. His missing arm and being a refugee left him to distrust my father's intentions.'
'When I was born, however, that changed. I was the only boy born to my grandfather's daughters and I would inherit his business.'
'Fate is cruel. As were the priests of the All-seeing Eye. Smoke?'
The woman looks pointedly at you.
Raphûz chuckles.'
Clear your throat to prompt Raphûz to respond with <rgb=#00FF00>/ahem</rgb>
Speak with Raphûz
Approach Raphûz's fire
<rgb=#00FF00>Talk</rgb> with the woman and tell her why you are here
Instance: A New Post
